Description: Heart Disease is characterized primarily by chest pain, shortness of breath, irregular heartbeat. Additional symptoms may include fatigue, dizziness, nausea, sweating, arm pain, jaw pain.
COVID-19 is characterized primarily by fever, dry cough, loss of taste, loss of smell. Additional symptoms may include fatigue, difficulty breathing, body aches, headache, sore throat.

Diabetes is characterized primarily by excessive thirst, frequent urination, extreme hunger. Additional symptoms may include unexplained weight loss, fatigue, blurred vision, slow healing sores, frequent infections.
Asthma is characterized primarily by wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness. Additional symptoms may include coughing, difficulty breathing, rapid breathing, anxiety.
Migraine is characterized primarily by severe headache, light sensitivity, sound sensitivity. Additional symptoms may include nausea, vomiting, vision changes, dizziness.
Hypertension is characterized primarily by headache, chest pain, irregular heartbeat. Additional symptoms may include shortness of breath, nosebleeds, dizziness, vision problems.
Arthritis is characterized primarily by joint pain, joint stiffness, swelling. Additional symptoms may include reduced mobility, weakness, fatigue, inflammation.
Pneumonia is characterized primarily by chest pain, fever, cough with phlegm. Additional symptoms may include shortness of breath, fatigue, chills, rapid breathing, sweating.
